Mutsuhisa BAN

  • GitHub Profile

Research Interest

  • Microeconomic Theory (Mechanism Design, Social Choice Theory, Game and Decision Theory)
  • Political Economy (Humanitarian Affairs, Conflict, Peace Building, Human Security)
  • Analytic Philosophy (Logic, Welfare and Justice)

Publication

  • “A Theoretical Analysis of Refugee Protection Mechanisms: Market Design Approach” Mimeo, 2014

Presentaion

  • “Granularity: Toward a study of 'Inter-systems Relations'” MAS International Workshop, The University of Tokyo, 2015 (upcoming)
  • “Quantum Foundation of Social Experiment: Weak Measurement Theory and Its Application”, Experimental Social Science Conference, Gifu-Shotoku Gakuen University, 2014
  • “Egalitarian Dynamic Mechanism Design”, Asian Symposium of Equity and Social Justice, 2014
  •   “Implementation of Humanitarian Desiderata without Benevolent Planner”, Annual Conference of Japan Association of Human Security Studies, Tohoku University, 2014  
  • “Social Welfare Measurement on Lexicographic Preferences”, Tokyo Institute of Technology, 2014  
  • “Applications of Combinatoric Game Theory for Humanitarian Protection”, Columbia University, 2014  
  • “A Theoretical Analysis of Refugee Protection Mechanisms: Market Design Approach”, Tokyo Institute of Technology, 2014   - “Designing Refugee Resettlement Mechanism with Humanitarian Social Choice Function”, Annual Conference of Japan Association of Human Security Studies, Keio University, 2013 
  • “Mechanism Design on Humanitarian Desiderata”, Annual Conference of Japan Association of Human Security Studies, Aichi University, 2012  
  • “Frame Problem and Normative Decision Theory“ Tokyo Institute of Technology, 2011
  • “Discovering Strategic Solutions to End Human Trafficking with Agent-Based Modeling”, Award prized, The National Research Competition for Undergraduates of Japan, Osaka University, 2010
